page.title: 08BELTON ESTATE.
page.content: This park and 600 acres of farmland were created by the 18th century landscape designer Capability Brown. The N & W is dominated by the Estate features. During the last 150 years some specimen trees & shrubs from S Europe and America have been introduced. A Nature Conservancy survey revealed a rich variety of over 120 trees & plant species along with an abundant & intersting wildlife. Belton has its own Nature Trail which passes through a wide selection of varied species. One of the finest a Cedar of Labanon imported in 1638, stands as a direct geographical contrast to 90ft tall Norwegian spruces. Grey squirrels, from North America thrive here. Great crested grebe, Canada geese, nuthatch and greater spotted woodpecker are just some of the amazing bird life.
